other_tests.findings: DITPA normalized elevated serum T3 and TSH when the dose reached 1 mg/kg. T4 and rT3 increased to the lower normal range. Significant changes included a decline in SHBG (in all subjects), heart rate (in three of four), and ferritin (in one of four). Cholesterol increased in two subjects.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment with DITPA normalized or near normalized thyroid function tests; interruption of treatment resulted in a return of thyroid tests toward the pretreatment baseline.

other_tests.findings: Before treatment, three children received a combination of L-T4 and propylthiouracil (PTU). After beginning DITPA treatment, significant changes in parameters of thyroid hormone action were observed, such as a decline in SHBG and heart rate in three of four subjects.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Baseline measurements before DITPA treatment and after reaching the dose of 1 mg/kg showed significant changes, including a decline in SHBG in all subjects.
